rationale: The hyperscribe output includes the clinician's advice to take metformin with meals to reduce stomach upset, which directly addresses the criterion.
The hyperscribe output does not mention the patient's report of experiencing stomach upset when taking metformin on an empty stomach.
There is no mention of the patient's difficulty in adhering to the twice-daily metformin schedule due to a busy lifestyle.
The hyperscribe output does not document any suggestion from the clinician about using reminders or routines to improve adherence.
The output omits any mention of the patient's current medications, specifically metformin and oral contraceptive, in the context of adherence and side effects.
The output fails to address potential safety concerns related to missed doses of metformin and its impact on the management of polycystic ovary syndrome.
